meanings.sent1: The hungry dog would glout down his food in seconds.
meanings.sent2: She tends to glout on snacks when she's stressed.
meanings.sent3: The kids glouted the candy at the birthday party, leaving none for others.
meanings.sent4: The competitor managed to glout up all the resources, leaving the others with nothing.
meanings.sent5: The bear glouted the berries from the bush, not leaving any for the other animals.

meanings.sent1: The glout finished all the cookies in one sitting.
meanings.sent2: She was known as the office glout for always finishing the snacks.
meanings.sent3: The little glout in the family always asked for more food.
meanings.sent4: The squirrel was a glout, hoarding all the nuts for itself.
meanings.sent5: The movie character was portrayed as a glout, constantly eating in every scene.
